dt.t: Her {it}conscience{/it} told her to tell the truth.

pt: The Latin word {it}scīre{/it}, meaning {ldquo}to know{rdquo} or {ldquo}to understand,{rdquo} gives us the root {b}sci{/b}. Words from the Latin {it}scīre{/it} have something to do with knowing or understanding. {b}Sci{/b}{it}ence{/it} is the understanding of the world and how everything in it works. A person's {it}con{/it}{b}sci{/b}{it}ence{/it} is the knowledge of right and wrong and the feeling that he or she should do right. Anything that is {it}con{/it}{b}sci{/b}{it}ous{/it} knows what it is feeling.
